programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Durham compete to host the best dinner party, beginning with Steph and James, who offer a night of gastropub favourites. Day two sees animal-lovers Gary and Amanda serve up two courses of fish on their homely-menu, and hosts Andy and Emma feel confident on the final night of the competition.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan Hatfield inspects a diamond eternity ring and a Victorian gold chain, a pair of very unusual painted cabinets featuring Salvador Dali and Frankenstein's monster, and a huge collection of boxing memorabilia. In Kent, siblings Charlie and Patrick Devine look at a gold disc that once belonged to rock band Oasis.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The Pickwicks staff in London try to secure deals on high-fashion footwear, while in Sheffield, London Road owner Dan takes in a multi-diamond deal from businesswoman `Botox Sue'.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer helps a couple who are at loggerheads over their priorities for their next property, with Becki wanting a ready-to-move-into family home, while Craig is looking for a bargain project in the popular suburbs of south Manchester. Kirstie Allsopp meets newlyweds Chris and Amy in Cheshire, who are looking to buy their first home together and want something semi-rural in pricey areas including Knutsford, Lymm and Frodsham.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Birmingham, Kirstie Allsopp helps 30-year-old neurosurgeon Naomi escape from a crowded shared house, guiding her through the property market of Moseley. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer has a challenge on his hands with a couple who want completely different things. Jon is looking for a one-bedroom flat in the city's stylish Jewellery Quarter, but Mo dreams of a quieter life.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. The Shoes is up first and hosts Billy Gowland and his partner Debbie Nelson find out if their budget rooms have proved too basic for the group. Next, James Moffat and his partner Annie Larner from Biggin Hall Hotel want to clear up their issues with Billy and Debbie. As the third hosts, Charles and Lisa Hooper from yurt glamp-site Forest Garden Shovelstrode confront their low scores from James. Finally, Fiona and James from the Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant make accusations of nitpicking and double standards.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Training guru Steve Carlyle hosts the first party in York, but a sophisticated evening, complete with a butler, does nothing to boost his reputation as he competes to win the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trevor Rooney, who leads tours of supposedly haunted sites in York, hosts the second dinner party in the city at a bric-a-brac warehouse. He also has several spooky surprises in store for his guests, including a magic show, a paranormal-themed menu and a ventriloquist's doll that spends the evening flirting with the female diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in York is hosted by Annie Albericci, who hopes to bring peace, love and harmony to the table with her festival-chic-themed evening. However, things go from bad to worse for Annie when the male guests find a racy photo of her.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Yvonne McGill hosts the fourth dinner challenge in York and goes for a 1960s-themed party, including a game of Snog, Marry, Avoid? and a Beatles tribute band. Meanwhile, guest Steve reveals his celebrity crush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Rebecca Ryan hosts the final dinner party in York, and hopes to impress her guests by throwing a Hollywood-themed evening of glitz and glamour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of an Italian restaurant in New Jersey, which is struggling due to a cumbersome menu, an unruly kitchen and confused staff. Gordon suggests carefully prepared meatballs will be popular with the clientele, but owner Joe Cerniglia needs to make some big changes.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers searching for properties in south London. Niki and Rob have £450,000 and want a home with enough space to allow them to start a family in the future, while Georgie and Louis have been commuting from Surrey for years and feel the time is right to move to the capital. But what will they find with a £220,000 budget?.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Staffordshire bull terrier puppy called Rex receives treatment for a badly deformed elbow, and the team carry out a complicated procedure to realign the bones. Meanwhile, a cross-breed called Piggy with spinal problems leaves its family facing a difficult decision, and Noel devises an unorthodox cure for a stray cat with a badly fractured leg.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman travels all the way from Romania in the hope that Professor Noel Fitzpatrick can mend her dog Clifford's squashed spinal cord. A golden Labrador is offered a total shoulder replacement and a puppy faces losing two of its toes after a collision with a plant pot.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Astronaut-in-training Nicky hopes to find romance with well-travelled motoring journalist Daniel. The restaurant also welcomes road sweeper Bruce, whose date is mother of two Yvonne. After years of being single, she's ready to put herself first and to find that one true love to keep her company into her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Archaeologist Sophie hopes Second World War enthusiast Mark will be the man for her. Also entering the romantic restaurant is comedian Kelly, who worries that she tends to intimidate men. Can high-flying entrepreneur Russell handle her banter? Plus, mum-of-four Heather, 72, hopes retired businessman Gary will keep her company in her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: New series. The popular 1990s game show returns - after last October's one-off revival as part of Stand Up to Cancer - for a full series, with comedian and film-maker Richard Ayoade stepping into the shoes of previous hosts Richard O'Brien, Edward Tudor Pole and Stephen Merchant. As the Maze Master, he will guide five intrepid celebrities - Ore Oduba, Vicky Pattison, Alex Brooker, Lydia Bright and Louie Spence - through the Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Future zones, where they play a range of skill, mystery, physical and mental challenges to win the all-important crystals. The more they win, the more time they have in the final test - the Crystal Dome.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First up is 24-year-old Rebecca, a singer from Nottinghamshire who is tired of always having her heart broken by guys with a bad boy image and wants to see if choosing a date in the studio can help her pick a better mate. Next up is 25-year-old development manager Dan from Durham, who has unsuccessfully tried countless dating apps and hopes to find Mr Right.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett taking on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf. Adam Riches joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A look at weather at its strangest and fastest. A cloud envelops a supersonic jet, an invasion of tumbleweed swamps an entire town, apocalyptic black rain falls from the skies in Iceland, and an onlooker captures a rare fire rainbow on film. In Japan, a skier searches for legendary `snow monsters' on the slopes of a ski resort, while a storm chaser comes face to face with seven towering waterspouts in the Florida Keys. There's also a blood-red waterfall, and what explains the most otherworldly place on Earth, where there are two suns and no horizon?.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and hilarious take on This Morning and Doctor Who, and sing along to The Sound of Music.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Water's Edge Guest House in Stratford-upon-Avon, where owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Fox Inn in Guisborough, where hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison hope to impress their guests with their northern B&B.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in at Ivanhoe Guest House in Bridlington, where Mick and Gill Jennings hope their simple approach will win the day. But Michael is quick to pick fault.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees Ross and Kath from The Kilpeck Inn confront Julie and Gerry's low hosting score, and accusations of tit-for-tat game-playing start to fly.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. Recruitment executive Michelle Watson turns her nose up at the salmon starter, while choir director Joseph Benneh sends his steak back to the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment executive Michelle Watson welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but the previous night's host Ray Dodd is hungry for revenge following stinging criticism of his efforts. Michelle's cooking also fails to impress Joseph Benneh, so her hopes of scooping the week's prize rest with her choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stuart Henson hosts a safari-themed dinner party on the third night in Milton Keynes. He hopes his exotic menu of zebra steak and `elephant dung surprise' will please his guests, but after the insults of the previous night he faces a difficult challenge to persuade his fellow diners to get along.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Choir director Joseph Benneh hosts the fourth dinner party in Milton Keynes, hoping the flavours from his homeland Ghana and a vocal masterclass will prove a winning combination. The guests' expectations are high, so he is under pressure to hit the spot with a menu that includes chicken liver pate, and groundnut soup with coconut rice.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country enthusiast Susan Rogers hosts the final dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, hoping her French cuisine will win her extra points. She also demonstrates her skills with an accordion and gives her guests an origami masterclass, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef heads to the Seascape restaurant in the village of Islip on Long Island, New York, in a bid to change the fortunes of its owner, who is nearly $1million in debt. Gordon is dismayed to discover unprotected meat and fish left next to mouldy pesto jars in the kitchen and plans to close down the eatery until radical changes are made.(n)

programme.title: The Book of Life
programme.desc: Premiere. A man who longs to be a musician instead of a bullfighter like his father has to compete with a childhood friend when they fall for the same woman. Their love triangle catches the eye of the spirits of the dead, leading him on a journey through their bizarre world. Animated adventure, with the voices of Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana and Channing Tatum.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapman's careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett taking on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf. Adam Riches joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. Plus, an 11-year-old boy is brought into hospital after running into a wall at school and hurting his wrist.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eighteen-year-old Lewis is rushed into the hospital after coming off his motorbike and colliding with two cars. He is immediately taken for a full body CT scan as doctors are concerned about the extent of the injuries to his pelvis, arm and head. Meanwhile, 27-year-old Sam awaits X-ray results after he fainted and cut his lip while smoking a Cuban cigar at a barbecue.(n)

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: A wealthy playboy inherits a media empire when his father dies. Determined to do some good for a change, he uses his new-found fortune to become a masked crime-fighter. Aided by his chauffeur, who is a kung fu expert and a technical genius, he fights to bring down a powerful gangster. Comic-book adventure, starring Seth Rogen, Jay Chou, Cameron Diaz and Christoph Waltz.(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Comic book adaptation. A genetic mutation causes mild-mannered Bruce Banner to turn into the green and muscular Incredible Hulk when he gets angry. While he searches for a cure, the military attempt to create their own genetically modified equivalent using one of their soldiers(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blind lawyer Matt Murdock, whose smell, touch, taste and hearing have been heightened as a result of a chemical accident, uses his superpowers to fight crime as the costumed vigilante Daredevil. With the help of Elektra, Murdock takes on mob boss Kingpin and his hired assassin Bullseye(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Shawn Roberts star in this sequel following an Iraq War veteran who is plagued by terrifying visions after returning home(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: American army chiefs begin to commit troops to Vietnam in 1964, starting with Lt Colonel Hal Moore and his Air Calvary Division. Training begins, and Moore's wife Julie joins the army wives to see the men off to battle. Arriving in South Vietnam they are assigned a search-and-destroy mission on rural land. Another platoon spots the enemy and gives chase, unaware they are heading toward a stronghold of the North Vietnamese army. Stranded under fire, the pressure is on for Moore's men, who fortify their position and begin a long, intense battle to save their comrades. It is the first of many such encounters in a brutal conflict..(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood makes a second outing in the role that established him as one of Hollywood's top stars. 'Dirty' Harry Callaghan is assigned to look into a series of murders of the city's unpunished criminals(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: Lincoln Rhyme is a NY detective specializing in forensics and the leading crimimologist in the country. Following a near fatal injury in the line of duty, he is now only able to move his head, shoulders and one finger. Feisty street-smart policewoman Amelia Donaghy, is on her last night of duty before a transfer to a desk job when she is led to a crime scene and discovers a grossly mutilated corpse. Working with Lincoln on the case, she must be his eyes, ears and legs in order to solve the crime to crack the case before the killer strikes again(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: Barry Levinson's comedy drama tells the story of manic forces radio DJ Adrian Cronauer hired to entertain the troops. His irreverent humour and madcap antics endear him to the grunts but bring him into direct conflict with his superiors. The film paints a broad picture of the conflict with Williams justifiably at centre stage in an achingly funny film(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: The film revolves around a tough cop named John Kimble who must take up an undercover assignment as a kindergarten teacher to find a drug dealer(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: The gloves come off when two best friends (Kate Hudson, Anne Hathaway) schedule their dream weddings for the same date, at the same place, at the same time and neither is willing to budge(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold. Action(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: A wimpy account manager (James McAvoy) is recruited by a sexy mystery woman (Angelina Jolie) to join a secret society of assassins and avenge the murder of his estranged father. Morgan Freeman costars in this non-stop action thrill ride. Directed by Timur Bekmambetov(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A young journalist must investigate a mysterious videotape which seems to cause the death of anyone in a week of viewing it(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: A desperate mother seeks the help of a pair of priests, when her angelic daughter becomes possessed by a terrible demon. Horror(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots..(n)

programme.title: Consenting Adults
programme.desc: A wealthy couple befriend their new neighbours, but do the newcomers have ulterior motives for their friendship? Thriller(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Comedy about conjoined twins whose bond is tested when one of them decides to become an actor in Hollywood(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie starring Wesley Snipes and Patrick Swayze about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two longtime friends take stock of their accomplished artistic careers in this meditative drama written and directed by Paolo Sorrentino. Michael Caine stars as Fred Ballinger, a retired composer who, at the behest of his daughter (Rachel Weisz), is on vacation in the Alps with his friend Mick Boyle (Harvey Keitel), a filmmaker currently working on a new project. Fred believes he is enjoying his retirement, but he is soon approached with an offer of a British knighthood if he'll conduct a performance of a famous piece he wrote(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: An uptight college dean is determined to have his most unruly frat house expelled, enlisting the help of the most respectable house on campus. Comedy(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Paul Walker puts the pedal to the metal in this high-octane sequel to 2001's "The Fast and the Furious." Walker returns as Brian O'Conner, a cop skilled at street racing. This time out, he goes undercover in Miami to take down a drug magnate. The result: relentless action, kinetic street racing and gravity-defying car chases(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: The early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes' career, from the late 1920s to the mid-1940s. His career spanned everything from oil, for which he cared little, to movies, casinos, and aviation - as he turned millions of dollars into billions(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Antonio Banderas, Rodrigo Santoro, and Martin Sheen star in this ensemble drama detailing the daring real-life rescue of 33 Chilean miners who were trapped in the San Jose Mine for 69 days in 2010. Patricia Riggen directs from a script by Jose Rivera and Mikko Alanne(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author hinds himself trapped at home after breaking his leg in a skiing accident. Bored by his plight, he uses his binoculars to observe events in an adjacent building - and soon believes he has witnessed a murder. Nathan Fillion stars in the 100th episode of the crime drama, with a plot loosely based on the Hitchcock thriller Rear Window.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a publishing executive last seen engaged in a heated argument over a taxi. They learn that the killing may have been a race hate crime, with their main suspect having a long history of prejudice. However, a technicality arises in the case, threatening to deny them the conviction. Starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate when a priest is found murdered in the confessional booth. The arrest of a teenager with a grudge seems to have them on the right track, but after discovering that the clergyman wasn't the killer's intended target they begin to focus their search on a petrol station cashier. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A DNA assessment of a kidnapping crime scene reveals horrifying results for Natalia, who discovers her sister Anya is one of a number of missing women. Racing to track her down, the team finds a collection of photographs that may hold the key to breaking the case. Starring David Caruso, Eva La Rue and Adam Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs's father is increasingly frustrated at being kept in his son's house under armed guard, and Franks joins his security detail after emerging from the convent where he had been hiding out. Meanwhile, Ducky finds evidence at a helicopter crash that gives the team an important lead in tracking down Paloma Reynosa, and the drug kingpin's brother Alejandro may have an ulterior motive when he tries to secure a deal involving her extradition. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The body of a woman who hacked a law office for a specific file is discovered in a water tank. It transpires she believed her actions were leading toward determining the killer of her best friend. Castle and Beckett investigate, while the pair's relationship reaches its next level. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: After Finch?s refusal to commit murder even to stop Samaritan from being activated, the team is on the run from Decima. As co-creator of the Machine, Finch is a major threat to Samaritan and the number one target for elimination. However, Greer believes he can flush him out of hiding by targeting his former fiancee.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a woman killed in a fall from her art studio rooftop. When the post-mortem reveals the presence of a drug in her system, detectives suspect she was doped - but there is a long list of suspects. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A private investigator's murder draws Briscoe and Green toward a case of corruption in a baseball league - where the manager will do anything to ensure his team wins. They learn the victim had unearthed a scandal in which an ineligible player was being fielded in every game - and his discovery may have led to his death. Detective drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Delko is rushed to hospital with potentially fatal gunshot wounds, and Horatio waits anxiously as medics try to revive him, while the rest of the team searches for his assailant. Calleigh and Ryan process the crime scene, and question a security guard who provides them with what appears to be vital information - until further evidence sheds new light on the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team members are surprised when Gibbs asks DiNozzo's father to join them in their investigation of a murder committed at the US Naval Academy. However, Tony Sr's experience turns out to play a vital role in the inquiry, which finds the team members hunting for a missing nuclear weapon they suspect is about to be sold on the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. The agents discover he is being targeted by terrorists who have hijacked a shipment of advanced weapons from the army. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A family falls victim to a robbery that ends in rape and murder, and the subsequent case leads to a Secret Service agent. Crime drama, starring Skeet Ulrich.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An investigation into the violent outbursts of two police officers leads Stabler and Benson to believe an anti-malaria drug issued by the armed forces is responsible for their behaviour. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler investigates an attack on a teenage girl, posing as a paroled sex offender to gain access to the halfway house and therapy group attended by the chief suspect. Unfortunately, Cragen soon begins to fear he is getting too involved in the case. Crime drama, guest starring Robert Patrick, with Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green go in search of a boy's killer - and are shocked when it appears a 10-year-old girl could be responsible. McCoy steps in, claiming she should be committed to a psychiatric hospital before other murders occur. Jerry Orbach stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Acting on a tip-off, Mac and the team discover old enemy Suspect X, a trained assassin, has resurfaced. In an attempt to stop the killer striking again, they set a trap to lure her into the open - and in the process make a chilling discovery about who was next on her list of victims. With Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella's life is endangered by an unexplained fire at her apartment building, and she is forced to evacuate everyone from the premises. Meanwhile, her fellow investigators deal with another mystery - in the form of a body discovered among the charred debris. With Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: As Dawson's life hangs in the balance, Voight focuses on bringing in Pulpo by whatever means necessary. The team soon discovers that the drug lord's right-hand man has been killed, and believes the only people Pulpo will turn to are his `second family'. Meanwhile, Jin takes a surreptitious look through Voight's computer and presents copies of a few files to Sgt Stillwell of Internal Affairs, the man who is trying to bring Hank down. Chicago Fire spin-off, starring Jason Beghe, Sophia Bush, Jon Seda, Jesse Lee Soffer and Patrick John Flueger.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Finch is on the case when the number of a janitor with a haunted past comes up, only for him to discover that the threat on the man's life comes from none other than Root. Crime drama, starring Michael Emerson and Amy Acker.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The team gets involved in international politics when Finch and Reese are given the number of a former government contractor who is stalking a UN diplomat. Meanwhile, an adversary tries to take advantage of Root. Drama, starring Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson.(n)

programme.desc: The postal detectives explore the mystery of true love when they deliver divorce papers to one couple on the same day as Oliver's missing wife reappears. Drama, starring Eric Mabius, Kristin Booth and Crystal Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Trace of Murder
programme.desc: A conniving woman yearns to divorce her husband and set up home with her lover - but a pre-nuptial agreement means she stands to lose out. Instead, she devises a cunning plan to nullify the contract, framing her unsuspecting spouse for the murder of a business rival. However, she reckons without the shabby sleuth's unfailing ability to uncover the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Shera Danese, Barry Corbin and David Rasche.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to locate a kidnapped girl but has to contend with her grandfather, a former member of a disbanded special forces unit. The agents discover he has been secretly negotiating with the kidnapper, who was once in his undercover team and has decided to kill off his old colleagues in a bid to atone for their actions. Meanwhile, Abby is forced to work with an intern, and makes him follow her idiosyncratic rules. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to the home of a bomb disposal expert who shot and killed an intruder during a robbery. The case appears to be straightforward until Tony discovers she lied about being alone during the incident, and the evidence suggests a link to a case in which a man walked free after paralysing a member of the public in a shootout. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team becomes involved in an international incident when the body of an American petty officer is found by an estate agent in a bungalow that has been repossessed. An indentation on the victim's skull leads the agents to believe he was killed on a British ship, but collecting evidence from the vessel proves challenging. Guest starring Tracy Middendorf, Daniel Gillies and Kristen Ariza.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the deaths of a radio DJ and a naval officer who were both killed during a live broadcast, only to discover there are a number of potential suspects. Evidence leads the agents to suspect the involvement of a radical group called Military at Home, prompting Tony to investigate an upmarket gated community - where his door-to-door inquiries yield an enticing proposition or two from the female residents. American drama, starring Michael Weatherly, with Nadia Bjorlin.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby becomes personally involved in the case of a murdered naval scientist who she regards as a kindred spirit. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.desc: A petty officer arriving at airport security dies during a random search. Conducting an autopsy on the body, Dr Wade suspects that he died from natural causes. programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Ted Koppel's Big Night Out. At a Yale-Harvard football tailgater , Emily (Kelly Bishop) is shocked by the revelation that her husband Richard (Edward Herrmann) has maintained a 30-year relationship with his former sweetheart Pennilyn Lott (Linda Gehringer), while Paris (Liza Weil) conducts a fateful interview with eminent professor/author Asher Fleming (Michael York, in his first series appearance). Meanwhile in Stars Hollow, Lorelai (Lauren Graham) finally accepts a dinner invitation from her father's young business partner Jason (Christopher Eigeman); and Rory reacts negatively to Luke's new waiter Brendon (Greg Cipes), whom she remembers for his "gross" behavior in high school. The real-life Yale Whiffenpoofs make a guest appearance(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls

Elsewhere, Lorelai learns more about Jason when she spends an unusual evening at his place; Michel is jealous of Davey's nanny and offers to baby-sit the infant; and Lane gets a job. programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

Daniel Radcliffe returns as the bespectacled young wizard who is now in his third year at Hogwarts. After and incident that sees his anger get the best of him, Harry runs away from the school. Unfortunately, the magical wunderkind soon learns that Sirius Black (Gary Oldman) has escaped from Azkaban prison and is after him. Dumbledore, racing to prepare Harry for a final battle that he knows is fast approaching, brings him on a perilous mission to find the key to unlock Voldemort's defenses. programme.title: Wild About Animals
programme.desc: One of the first projects of syndicated TV producer Steve Rotfield, the weekly half-hour Wild About Animals was hosted by actress Mariette Hartley. The series cast its spotlight on rare animals, unique to specific regions of the United States. Regular weekly features included "K9 Cops and Animal Heroes," "Celebrity Owners," and "Animal Bloopers." First telecast in the fall of 1995, Wild About Animals was still flourishing at the end of the 20th century, by which time it was being shown in tandem with two other Rotfield efforts, The Lighter Side of Sports and Awesome Adventures, in most local markets(n)

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and Chris Pine star in this intense action thriller, the final work to be directed by the late Tony Scott. Veteran railroad employee Frank Barnes has his quarrels with the young, new guy on the job, Will Colson - largely because the younger man is about to replace him. But the two must join forces and race against time when an enormous runaway train carrying toxic chemicals heads their way. If its terminal destination in a city wasn't bad enough, the lethal behemoth is also on the same line as another train, aboard which are 150 children who are returning from a school trip. When the railroad company's chairman refuses to take action for financial reasons, Frank takes it upon himself to save the day, despite the seemingly suicidal nature of the mission and the devastating consequences it's likely to have for his loved ones. Will opposes Frank's ridiculously dangerous idea, but joins him anyway. Can the two men patch up their differences and save the day? In addition to the nail-biting action, the score beautifully highlights the suspense, and earned the film a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Sound Editing(n)

Peter Sarsgaard, Chloe Sevigny, Rosario Dawson, Hank Azaria(n)

programme.title: Off-Air
programme.desc: Off-Air(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: In a 1950s-era alternate universe where domesticated zombies play a functional role in society by delivering the milk, carrying the mail, and even helping out with household chores, one boy is about to find out just how big of a personal responsibility "pet" ownership truly is. When the Earth passed through a cloud of space dust and the dead arose from their graves to devour the flesh of the living, it first seemed that all hope for humanity was lost. Society's rapid slide into chaos, however, was soon halted when scientists at a company called ZomCom created a special collar that turned the rampaging animated corpses docile. Now, thanks to ZomCom, everything is under control -- or is it? Timmy Robinson (K'Sun Ray) isn't quite convinced. Quiet and withdrawn, the skeptical young boy spends so much time locked away in his room that he's almost become invisible around the household. His mother Helen (Carrie-Anne Moss) has recently purchased a zombie to help keep things tidy around the house though, and when the creature attempts to engage the curious youngster in a game of catch, a friendship is forged between boy and zombie that finds the amiable gut-muncher nicknamed Fido (Billy Connolly) practically becoming a part of the family. Things take a turn for the worse however, when Fido's collar malfunctions and Timmy's neighbors begin dying in droves. When ZomCom's top zombie control specialist Mr. Bottoms (Henry Czerny) moves in across the street from Timmy, the increasingly complicated situation threatens to place a serious stumbling block in the path of human-zombie relations(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening

Worried that she will soon be unable to suppress the killer instincts boiling up within her, and with a horde of murderous hybrids on her trail, it will be only a matter of time before planet Earth becomes the ultimate extraterrestrial battleground(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials

The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley ends the week in Leicester, where she meets leading forensic scientists who are investigating historical mysteries and modern-day cases.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Plaistow, east London, Hoddesdon in Hertfordshire and Wellington, Shropshire.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: West Yorkshire police track down a man facing a year in prison for a crime he committed more than 10 years ago and a Liverpool drug dealer on the run from prison is found in Madrid.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates an overcrowded property without electricity, and housing officers come across an outbuilding taking up almost as much space as the house it belongs to.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents as a team of gym enthusiasts take on a punk rock singer and an actress at Lincoln Antiques Fair, with help from experts Raj Bisram and Kate Bliss.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel intervenes to help a couple forced apart by the death of an alcoholic family member reconcile, forgive, and move forward. Rob experiences life in front of the camera.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: The current set of players faces its final day competing for the chance to win £10,000 before 24 new faces arrive. Game show, hosted by Rick Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In Devon, Alistair Appleton helps a couple of journalists find a country home with holiday let potential on a budget of £700,000. Away from the hunt, he meets a young sheep farmer.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Aiden Byrne, Stephen Terry, Mary Ann Gilchrist and Matt Gillan compete with their chosen home cook partners, with Pierre Koffmann judging their final dishes. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Neighbours turn out to surprise a couple from Nailsea, Somerset, who have used their own experience of disability to help others. Presenters Paul Martin and Irina Aggrey collect donated items to sell at a street auction on their doorstep.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jerry Springer host the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Invented In
programme.desc: From the world's first computer programmer to the multi-million pound apps of today, Suzi Perry uncovers London's technology pioneers of the past, present and future.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Abi's friends and family gather to celebrate her 21st birthday, but with tensions simmering between Steven, Josh, Lauren and the guest of honour herself, things do not go the way she was hoping. Denise prepares for her interview, while Kush worries about the event in the park earlier - just as the police are visiting Keegan about the incident.(n)

programme.title: Count Arthur Strong
programme.desc: What begins as `an old-man version of a sleepover' turns into something slightly more sinister, leaving Michael trying to escape. Comedy, with Steve Delaney and Rory Kinnear.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: New series. The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career, featuring clips from his TV shows, highlights from his chat show appearances and his music videos, including a special appearance by former newsreader Trevor McDonald.(n)

programme.title: Tracey Breaks the News
programme.desc: Tracey Ullman returns with a one-off political and topical offering, filmed close to transmission and broadcast in the aftermath of the general election. For the first time Tracey is taking on an impression of Theresa May, alongside favourites Angela Merkel and Nicola Sturgeon. The show features a mix of famous political figures and everyday people reacting to the election results and the anniversary of the Brexit vote. As the election result will have global implications, the show also looks at the reaction of the Russians, Europeans and - Melania Trump.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by an array of acting talent this evening, and there is music by Haim, who perform Want You Back. Dame Judi Dench discusses her role as Queen Victoria in new film Victoria and Abdul, Steve Carell and Kristen Wiig are back together in Despicable 3, and Jamie Foxx talks about musical caper Baby Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Video
programme.desc: An inept would-be film-maker decides to document his brother's wedding on video. The bride's social climbing family is determined this will be the most spectacular event imaginable, setting in motion a series of disasters the camera-wielding best man is on hand to record. Comedy, starring Rufus Hound, Lucy Punch and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and musician Bill Bailey joins host Michel Roux Jr to sample dishes prepared in the studio by chocolatier William Curley and Chinese cookery expert Ching He Huang.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge joins host Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to reveal how the consumer can spend less on food without sacrificing flavour, creating a mouth-watering meal using breast of lamb for just £2 a head. Drinks expert Kate Goodman reveals the hidden costs in bargain basement bottles of booze, while comedienne and actress Arabella Weir argues that eating well is not an option for the poorest in society.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two wild swimmers go up against a pair of lifeguards in Builth Wells, with the assistance of Caroline Hawley and Colin Young. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott goes on a social history trip, and is flummoxed by an interesting find at the fair.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The AEGON Championships. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the sixth day of the famous grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the men's singles semi-finals. Defending champion Andy Murray was pushed all the way in his match against Marin Cilic at this stage last year, as he eventually prevailed 6-3, 4-6, 6-3, while Milos Raonic defeated Bernard Tomic 6-4, 6-4. With commentary by Andrew Castle, Andrew Cotter, John Lloyd and Peter Fleming, and reports from John Inverdale. Coverage continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present as another selection of celebrities take part in the general knowledge quiz. This time, the duo open the contest to famous faces who made a name for themselves early in life. Outnumbered's Tyger Drew-Honey teams up with This Is England's Thomas Turgoose, while Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory's Julie Dawn Cole joins forces with Oliver! star Mark Lester. Plus, former Grange Hill stars Lee MacDonald and Erkan Mustafa take on old classmate Michelle Gayle as she partners ex-Coronation Street actor Adam Rickitt.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Friendship drives the Doctor to make the rashest decision of his many lives when, trapped on board a giant spaceship, caught in the event horizon of a black hole, he witnesses the death of someone he pledged to protect. For a man well-accustomed to bending the laws of time to his advantage, now every passing second seems to be leading to an awful loss beyond even his control. However, he remains determined to overcome the odds and redeem his mistake, but prevailing against time itself could be one battle too many for the Time Lord. Sci-fi adventure, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie, Matt Lucas and Michelle Gomez.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: The choral music contest continues, as Mel Giedroyc gives another diverse selection of choirs a chance to compete in head-to-head knock-out challenges. This week's entrants are all-female pop choir The City Academy Songbirds, a group of soul singers Soul Train, Scot Soul, a group of five childhood friends from Loch Lomond, YouTube a cappella sensations Out of the Blue, Rat Pack-inspired quartet The Flyboys and pop choir The Noteables. Chaka Khan takes a seat on the panel, to help resident judges Gareth Malone and Kelis to deliver their expert opinions on each performance.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Alicia's concerns about Ethan escalate when she discovers he hasn't been sleeping, and has instead been keeping watch outside of Scott Ellisson's flat. Elsewhere, Iain and Lily begin the day with a spring in their step after their night together, but cracks begin to show in their blossoming relationship when they disagree over how to deal with an elderly couple hospitalised following a botched suicide pact. Plus, sparks fly between Connie and Sam.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy goes to extreme lengths to impress her psychologist boyfriend, much to Agnes's disgust, while Rory locates the perfect apartment for him and Dino - the problem is, it's in Kilbride, meaning he'll have to learn to drive. Mark prepares to emigrate to Australia. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: The Proposal
programme.desc: A Canadian publishing editor working in New York faces deportation to her own country. Desperate to stay in America, she offers her assistant a promotion if he will marry her, but an immigration official becomes suspicious and the pair are forced to go to desperate lengths to look like a happy couple. Romantic comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Ryan Reynolds.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Radio and TV presenter Sandi Toksvig joins Brian Conley to revisit memorable shows from her childhood, including Top of the Pops, The Good Life and coverage of the moon landings.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams battle it out in Peterborough hoping to find the best antiques to sell for profit, with help from Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant. Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Matt Gillan puts three cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make poached eggs with hazelnut emulsion. Only one of the amateurs can join him in the final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mike Reid shocks with when he pairs his fish with white chocolate and strawberry. Selin Kiazim's dish uses barbecued octopus and potato rostis as the central elements, while Tom Kemble creates poached buttered trout, but will it be enough to impress the show's veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Yorkshire Wolds Way
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire Wolds Way with Paul Rose.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adventurer Paul Rose concludes his exploration of the 79-mile Yorkshire Wolds Way, taking to the skies to get a unique view of its stretch of chalk downland. He also receives a special invitation to a military base that has been keeping the nation safe since the start of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions and interviews. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The AEGON Championships. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the fifth day of the famous grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the men's singles quarter-finals. Eventual winner Andy Murray defeated fellow Brit Kyle Edmund at this stage in 2016 to set up a semi-final clash against Croatia's Marin Cilic. With commentary by Andrew Castle, Andrew Cotter, John Lloyd and Peter Fleming, and reports from John Inverdale.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Niall Strawson and Simon King for another test of wildlife knowledge, hosted by Kate Humble.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest-scoring chefs from Northern Ireland cook for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis player Mansour Bahrami as guest judge. Only one contender can be chosen to represent the region in the national finals, taking them a step closer to cooking at the Wimbledon Championships.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: New series. Jo Whiley, Huw Stephens and Clara Amfo present coverage of the world renowned Glastonbury festival of Contemporary Performing Arts in Pilton, Somerset. The team look towards the weekend ahead and bring news, highlights and performances from the myriad of famous stages on the first day of the festival.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: In the series finale, Louis XIV learns the names of the nobles who purchased the poisons, but a last fatal batch reaches the palace, and humiliated Madame de Montespan has a plan for it. Facing a flaming death, brazen Madame Agathe predicts doom for the King and his royal line, while Sophie is torn emotionally and traitorous Thomas realises Philippe is only acting affectionately to feed him misinformation, making their final bedroom tryst a bloody affair. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Twenty-three years since the band's debut at Worthy Farm, Mark Radcliffe and Lauren Laverne look back over Radiohead's history with Glastonbury festival, before handing over to Jo Whiley for coverage of the headline set on the Pyramid Stage by the Oxfordshire five-piece. Following the performance, Jo and Mark reflect on the set, and look back at some of the other artists that have played on the first day of the festival.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: London Tower Fire: Britain's Shame - Panorama.
programme.desc: The fire believed to have started on the fourth floor of Grenfell Tower in Kensington, west London, engulfed almost the entire 24-storey building at shocking speed. Richard Bilton investigates what happened that night, examining why residents' fears about safety were apparently ignored and why the flames spread so quickly through the block.(n)

programme.title: Glasgow 1967: The Lisbon Lions
programme.desc: Fifty years after Celtic became the first British team to win the European Cup, this documentary tells the stories of the men who were part of that squad, featuring unseen archive footage, fans' stories and moving testimonies from Bertie Auld, Bobby Lennox, Jim Craig, John Clark, Willie Wallace, former Rangers captain John Greig and the players' families.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord finally gets a chance to find out whether he really is Scottish, or just cross, as he and Bill visit ancient Aberdeenshire. Their mission: to solve the mystery of what happened to the Ninth Legion of the Roman army, which vanished from records after marching beyond Hadrian's Wall and into the mists of Scotland during the second century. Bill has cooked up a theory about the fate that befell the missing soldiers, but what she discovers is far more dangerous - a cairn on a hillside containing a doorway to the end of the world. Sci-fi drama, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Love Affair
programme.desc: Two strangers have a whirlwind romance on a cruise, despite being engaged to other people. They decide to wait to see if their feelings change before leaving their partners, and agree to meet at the Empire State Building in six months if they choose to be together. However, when the date arrives, a tragic accident keeps them apart. Romantic drama, starring Charles Boyer and Irene Dunne.(n)

programme.title: Odette
programme.desc: The French widow of an English soldier offers her services to British Intelligence, and is sent undercover as a spy in Nazi-occupied France. However, her work alongside the resistance leads to her falling into the clutches of the Gestapo. Fact-based Second World War drama, with Anna Neagle, Trevor Howard, Peter Ustinov and Marius Goring.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty takes to the water to electronically tag the fins of basking sharks off the West Coast of Ireland so their movements can be tracked by scientists. Back onshore, his self-sufficiency efforts are sabotaged by otters that raid his lobster creels, and his dog Reuben, which accidentally savages him while he is out winkle picking.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Port Talbot, Wimbledon and Telford.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the Northern Ireland heats sees returning contender Eddie Attwell and newcomers Joery Castel and Tommy Heaney prepare their starters for the banquet. Eddie is using a number of modern techniques, Joery hopes to impress with a tribute to 1996 Wimbledon champion Richard Krajicek, while Tommy creates a warm salad. Who will win the favour of the veteran judge?.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Northern Ireland chefs prepare their seafood courses as they try to win a place at the Taste of Summer banquet honouring 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. Joery Castel combines mackerel and cucumber in his dish, Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's apparent love of sushi and Eddie Attwell creates five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his effort.(n)

programme.title: Splash
programme.desc: A lonely New Yorker is rescued from drowning by a mermaid, who falls in love with him and assumes human form so she can seek him out in Manhattan. He is soon equally smitten, and she resolves to keep her true nature a secret from him. However, an obsessive scientist suspects the truth and plans to prove it. Romantic fantasy comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Daryl Hannah and John Candy.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson goes property hunting in rural Wiltshire with a couple who have £950,000 to buy a family home with land, where they and their young children can enjoy a self-sufficient lifestyle. Jules also takes time out to find out about the county's glove-making heritage and sees some famous examples made for famous figures.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a tree fern in the damp garden and uses netting to protect his soft fruits from birds. Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her Plant of the Month, Flo Headlam visits an inspiring church garden in Lewisham that feeds both the mind and body, and Nick Bailey gets an insight into the impact of parasitoid wasps on gardens. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Anita Manning and James Lewis value antiques and collectibles at Balbirnie House in Fife, including a Moorcroft pin dish and a Troika vase, before a selection are sold at auction in Edinburgh. Presenter Paul Martin also visits Falkland Palace.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Nick Grimshaw begin the BBC's TV coverage of the second day of the annual music festival in Somerset, with performances by Jools Holland and Craig David.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Cameraman Charlie Hamilton James has been captivated by otters for the last 25 years and has filmed them more than anyone else. Now, through the eyes of three river orphaned otters, he sets out to reveal their survival secrets and exactly why he believes these creatures are so special.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Nick Grimshaw present highlights from the Pyramid Stage, where pop starlet Katy Perry makes her debut Glastonbury appearance today. Plus, the best performances from across the festival ground throughout the second day, and another selection of bespoke acoustic music.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Jo Whiley present live, uninterrupted coverage of this evening's headline set by Foo Fighters. Fans and attendees will both be hoping frontman Dave Grohl will be taking good care of himself before travelling to Worthy Farm this weekend; he and his band were due to perform as a headline act at the 2015 festival, but were forced to pull out after Grohl broke his leg during an on-stage stunt at a concert in Sweden. Beyond the US rockers' set, Lauren Laverne and Huw Stephens will be touring the festival grounds to take in a few more acoustic performances.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe and Alice Levine present highlights from the set by the classic English-American rock band The Pretenders, who opened up the Other Stage earlier today.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.sub-title: Kris Kristofferson and Royal Blood at Glastonbury 2017.
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe and Alice Levine introduce highlights from two contrasting artists performing on the Pyramid Stage on the first day of the world famous festival. Starting off with a debut Glastonbury performance from the legendary American singer-songwriter Kris Kristofferson, followed by Brighton's rock-duo, Royal Blood.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne introduces some very special guests for a performance at the Park Stage at this year's Glastonbury festival at Worthy Farm.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2
programme.sub-title: Sounds of the 70s 2: Art House Glam - Get in the Swing.
programme.desc: Collection of archive performances by artists including the Kinks, Roxy Music, Elton John, New York Dolls, Queen, Sparks and Rod Stewart. Plus, a rediscovered recording of David Bowie singing The Jean Genie from January 1973.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Coverage of the east London rapper Dizzee Rascal's performance as the Friday night headline act on the West Holts Stage at this year's festival.(n)

programme.title: Play It Loud: The Story of the Marshall Amp
programme.desc: In the early 1960s drum shop owner Jim Marshall launched the loudest amplifier in the world at a point in time widely perceived to be the birth of rock. Young musicians like Clapton and Hendrix rushed to adopt the revolutionary `Marshall sound', and the electric guitar spoke for a new generation, while stacks and walls became an essential backdrop at concerts. The company was rescued from financial meltdown by comic exposure in the 1984 movie This Is Spinal Tap, and the electronic boxes were propelled to iconic status. This documentary charts the amp's history, with contributions from rock musicians Pete Townshend, Lemmy and Slash, plus an interview with the founder himself.(n)

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena.(n)

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by celebrated musicians Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter. Other artists featured include Manitas de Plata, Ry Cooder, Thin Lizzy and AC/DC, while Fleetwood Mac's Albatross and In the City by the Jam are among the classic songs seen again in clips from the BBC's 1970s music shows.(n)

programme.title: Play It Loud: The Story of the Marshall Amp
programme.desc: In the early 1960s drum shop owner Jim Marshall launched the loudest amplifier in the world at a point in time widely perceived to be the birth of rock. Young musicians like Clapton and Hendrix rushed to adopt the revolutionary `Marshall sound', and the electric guitar spoke for a new generation, while stacks and walls became an essential backdrop at concerts. The company was rescued from financial meltdown by comic exposure in the 1984 movie This Is Spinal Tap, and the electronic boxes were propelled to iconic status. This documentary charts the amp's history, with contributions from rock musicians Pete Townshend, Lemmy and Slash, plus an interview with the founder himself.(n)

programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe and Alice Levine begin BBC Four's Glastonbury coverage today with highlights from this afternoon's sets by Jamaican group Toots & the Maytals and Liam Gallagher.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Alice Levine and Mark Radcliffe continue to provide live coverage from Worthy Farm, as the Brooklyn-based US indie-rockers The National perform at the Pyramid Stage this evening.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe and Alice Levine present live coverage from the John Peel Stage, where the American singer-songwriter Father John Misty is performing this evening.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Further live coverage of this evening's performances on the West Holts stage, as the veteran funk-pop family band The Jacksons play their evening set.(n)

programme.desc: An edition of the long-running music show, featuring studio performances and videos from acts in the Top 40 singles chart.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great Gay Buildings
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by seven fellow celebrities to mark the 50th anniversary of the 1967 Sexual Offences Act, which decriminalised private homosexual acts between men. The group explores the histories of several buildings that became cornerstones in the battle for gay rights in the UK. The Rev Richard Coles revisits the hedonistic past of London's Heaven Nightclub, while Mary Portas visits Shibden Hall near Halifax to celebrate the life of 19th-century lesbian heiress Anne Lister. Craig Revel Horwood investigates Britain's drag scene at the Royal Vauxhall Tavern, and Simon Callow tells the story of Oscar Wilde's downfall at the Old Bailey. Plus, Rikki Beadle-Blair visit the Theatre Royal Haymarket to remember how the British public showed their support for John Gielgud after he was arrested for cottaging, and Liz Carr takes in Bletchley Park, the one-time home of Alan Turing. Finally, Waheed Alli tells the story of recent battles for gay right in the Houses of Parliament.(n)
