programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.sub-title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door: When Neighbours Attack.
programme.desc: The story of Falkirk man Brian, who found himself in a six-year dispute with his neighbour over their shared-access drive. James was building a 26-room home and the number of delivery trucks began to grate on Brian - and when the two came to blows, one of them was left in hospital while the other faced trial. Plus, a marketing executive who found the more she complained about her neighbour's loud music, the more abusive the woman's boyfriend became, and a community in Bradford upset when travellers set up camp in the car park of their social club.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away Special.
programme.desc: In an episode full of surprises, agents Paul and Steve make a dangerous discovery leading to them calling the police. Elsewhere, Stewart and Elmore face a moral dilemma, and Paul and Steve hear a story that stops them in their tracks.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The officers try to recover £5,500 owed by a travel agent to a dissatisfied customer in east London, and in Birmingham the agents chase over £2,000 owed by a convenience store owner to a supplier. Elsewhere, in Staffordshire, two officers try to collect several thousand pounds owed by a pensioner after a dispute with his neighbour went all the way to the High Court.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.desc: A collection of comic clips featuring youngsters that have taken the internet by storm, featuring sassy six-year-old Johanna belting out her version of Aretha Franklyn's Respect and three-year-old April who, after a disastrous encounter with a bottle of nail polish, attempts to persuade her father that the resulting mess was all her doll's fault. Narrated by Iain Lee.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady's revival of the dating game show continues, as a former member of the Royal Air Force embarks on a mission to find her very own Prince Charming, and a male swimwear model takes his pick of three single ladies. Plus, Paul catches up with last week's matches to discover whether their first dates were a success.(n)

programme.title: Before They Were Stars
programme.desc: Dale Winton's candid tour back through TV history concludes, as he highlights more embarrassing early brushes with fame endured by some of today's biggest stars. Film stars, popular presenters and pop and rock legends are all fair game, as their first forays into showbusiness are unearthed, but among the ill-advised ventures are a few treasures that hint at the future potential of these fledgling stars.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: The Story of
programme.desc: Profile of the comedian, examining her early years performing at the Edinburgh Festival in the 1990s, inspired by her hero Eric Morecambe. Her act led to supporting roles in Smack the Pony, Absolutely Fabulous and Not Going Out, before reaching stardom with writing and starring in her successful sitcom and a dramatic role in Call the Midwife.(n)

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle UK
programme.sub-title: Lip Sync Battle UK: Manford v Keegan.
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and actress Michelle Keegan go head to head lip-synching to a hit song, complete with dance moves, facial expressions and costumes. Presented by former Spice Girl Melanie Brown and rapper Professor Green.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Kane gives a killer performance as a deranged, hulking psychopath who terrorizes eight teens working to rehab a decrepit hotel. It's no-holds-barred mayhem as the murderer employs a variety of different weapons and instruments to dispatch his victims. Directed by Gregory Dark. WWE head Vince McMahon serves as executive producer. Steven Vidler, Christina Vidal, Michael J. Pagan, Samantha Noble, Cecily Polson, Luke Pegler, Penny McNamee, Craig Horner(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: In 1974 scientists mixed extraterestrial DNA with human DNA to create a new species. The creature, now a young girl, escapes and mutates into a beuatiful young woman intent on seducing unknowing men(n)

programme.title: Half Past Dead
programme.desc: After infiltrating a crime syndicate, an undercover FBI agent lands in prison, where he tries to thwart a plot to recover stolen gold(n)

programme.title: Sgt. Bilko
programme.desc: Steve Martin is Sgt. Bilko an army man / Con Man that is involved in all kinds of scams from renting out the military motorpol to gambling and racketeering(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Inspiring fact-based basketball saga about Texas Western, the first NCAA championship squad to start five black players. Josh Lucas stars as coach Don Haskins. Derek Luke, Emily Deschanel. Jon Voight costars as legendary University of Kentucky coach Adolph Rupp. Directed by James Gartner(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risked her life's savings to produce and market her invention of the Miracle Mop. The success of that invention sparked her television-shopping business empire(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Rock drummer Fish gets a second shot at fame 20 years after getting kicked out of his band on the very night they signed the record contract that made them stars(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell fights to prevent a resurrected Chinese emperor taking over the world(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A mysterious artificial being evolves faster than anticipated, and a corporate consultant is enlisted to determine the test subject's fate(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A futuristic cyborg is sent to present-day Los Angeles to assassinate a woman, who will bear the child who will someday save humanity(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this feature-film adaptation of the popular fantasy video-game series. After realizing that their home is becoming uninhabitable, a race of orcs travel to the land of Azeroth. There, they encounter the realm's human denizens, who fight back against the invaders. In time, an orc warrior (Toby Kebbell) forges an alliance with a group of humans in order to overthrow his race's corrupt leader (Daniel Wu) and bring peace to the land. Directed by Duncan Jones (Moon), the film co-stars Paula Patton (Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol), Ben Foster (3:10 to Yuma), Dominic Cooper (The Devil's Double), Ruth Negga (World War Z), and Travis Fimmel (Vikings)(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Docudrama about the true story of the Deepwater Horizon disaster, which resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in US history. The film depicts the challenges the oil rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Retired auto worker, Korean War veteran and widower Walt Kowalski (Eastwood) is waiting out the rest of his life. His neighbors have all moved or passed away, replaced by Hmong immigrants he despises and aimless gangs of African American and Latino teenagers. Then someone tries to steal his prized Gran Torino, the car he helped built on his own assembly line. And by standing up to the thieves, Walt Kowalski becomes the unintended hero who changes the lives of his neighbors, of a boy being pushed into crime by local gangs -- and of his own life as well(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: As they await eviction from a Miami hotel, four retired mobsters try to scare off the other residents by making them an offer they can't refuse. Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss. Donatelli: Dan Hedaya. Donato: Seymour Cassel. Det. Neal: Carrie-Anne Moss. Ferris: Jennifer Tilly. Directed by Michael Dinner(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Rand Ravich's sci-fi thriller stars Johnny Depp (soon to be seen as J M Barrie in Neverland ) as a Nasa astronaut who loses all contact for two minutes while on a space-walk. Successfully rescued and back on Earth, he gives up his career to join a large corporation, much to the relief of his wife Charlize Theron (soon to be seen in Reindeer Games ). But, as he starts to act more strangely, she begins to wonder what actually happened in those 120 seconds and what this could mean for their unborn child(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: In debt to a gangster, petty criminal Gerard Butler pulls off a heist that has repercussions in the underworld. Guy Ritchie caper. Strong language/violence/mature themes. (2008)(110 mins)(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold. Action(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between an aspiring cop and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) as they pursue a Miami drug lord together with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Volunteers
programme.desc: Comic romp in which a spoilt playboy gambler joins the Peace Corps in Thailand to avoid his creditors, but then finds himself embroiled with local black marketeers and the CIA(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Based on the true story of how Charlie Wilson, an alcoholic womaniser and Texas congressman, persuaded the CIA to train and arm resistance fighters in Afghanistan to fend off the Soviet Union. With the help of rogue CIA agent, Gust Avrakotos, the two men supplied money, training and a team of military experts that turned the ill-equipped Afghan freedom-fighters into a force that brought the Red Army to a stalemate and set the stage for conflicts in the Middle East that still rage to this day(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: A plane crash leaves a compulsive workaholic stranded on a deserted island for more than four years, where he's forced to adjust to a new life of solitude(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: In the wake of the detonation of a 'dirty bomb' in LA and under the instruction of a public service announcement, Brad barricades himself within his home. With his wife Lexi on her way to work, he desperately tries to call her in an attempt to find out if she is safe and well. As time elapses and his worse fear looks set to manifest, Lexi appears outside the family home. If he allows his wife inside, he risks contaminating the house with deadly germs..(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster is put through the wringer by suspense director David Fincher ("Seven") in this taut thriller. When thieves break into their Manhattan brownstone, a single mother (Foster) and her daughter hide in a high-tech, fortified "safe room." But as it turns out, the money the crooks are after is in that room. Kristen Stewart, Forest Whitaker, Dwight Yoakam, Jared Leto(n)

programme.desc: My Life in Four Cameras. J.D.'s imagination is sparked by a patient, a sitcom writer, who is about to receive some very bad news. J.D. ponders how the lives of everyone at Sacred Heart, including his patient, would turn out if left in the hands of the writer(n)

programme.title: Scrubs

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Best Laid Plans. JD becomes frustrated with Kylie(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Boss's Free Haircut. Carla & Turk are experiencing marital difficulties, so J.D. and Elliot do their part to try and cheer them up. Dr. Cox challenges Dr. Kelso to take on a few patients of his own(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Drastic Voyage: Part II. The conclusion of the Series 6 finale sees the end of the gang's most incredible voyage(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: The Figgis Agency. In the seventh season premiere, Archer breaks into a mansion to repair a Hollywood starlet's honour(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: The Handoff. Archer and Lana make a handoff while the others listen to the best voicemail ever(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The Cryonic Woman. When Fry and Bender decide to take the Planet Express ship out for a joy ride and end up damaging the building, they get themselves and Leela fired. Leela decides to get her old job back at the Cryogenics lab, but accidentally switches her old career chip with Fry's. She ends up working as a pizza delivery girl while Fry and Bender have new jobs as cryogenics counselors. Fry and Bender are enjoying their new jobs when Fry unfreezes his old girlfriend Michelle from a thousand years ago. It turns out Michelle's life went downhill after Fry left and she froze herself to get a new start(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Parasites Lost. When Fry eats an egg-salad sandwich from a vending machine at a gas station, he begins to have strange side-effects -- he becomes stronger and smarter. Professor Farnsworth makes a diagnosis and concludes that Fry had ingested "intelligent worms" that have set up shop in his body. Because these worms are so smart, the regular means of flushing them out will not work. The Planet Express crew makes miniature robotic versions of themselves and enter Fry's body to fight off the intruders. Meanwhile Leela is left to divert Fry's attention, but finds herself more and more attracted to the new man Fry has become(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Amazon Women in the Mood. Fry and the others find themselves trapped on a planet of Amazonian women, ruled by a man-hating computer. With the guest voice of Bea Arthur(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bendless Love. Bender's best talent---bending things---lands him a scab job where a knockout fembot comes between him and an old friend(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: The Day the Earth Stood Stupid
programme.desc: The Day the Earth Stood Stupid. Curiously immune, Fry is Earth's only hope against a species called Brain Spawn that is making the populace stupid. Billy West, Katey Sagal, Tress MacNeille(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Gluten Free Ebola. When bad things happen to a scientist explaining how gluten is fine, the whole of South Park goes gluten free - can the cure to the gluten epidemic be found before it's too late?(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The F Word. The boys confront a group of obnoxious bikers, but their methods force the townsfolk to redefine the meaning of a rather offensive word. Time to update the English Dictionary!(n)

programme.title: Wedding Crashers
programme.desc: In the art of crashing weddings, John Beckwith (Owen Wilson) and Jeremy Grey (Vince Vaughn) are Washington D.C.'s undisputed masters. Guided by their intricate wedding-crashing rules, each week they charm their way into a different wedding -- and romance a different woman to boot. But when they crash the biggest wedding of the year, the ultimate crashers soon find themselves in over their heads as they become hilariously entangled in the eccentricity of the influential political family hosting the event. Christopher Walken, Jane Seymour, Rachel McAdams, Isla Fisher, and Bradley Cooper round up a cast with impressive star wattage and impeccable comedic timing(n)

programme.desc: Jeff Dunham performs live at the Dolby Theatre, featuring a special performance from country singer Brad Paisley and guest appearances by comedian Chris Parnell and former UFC champion Chuck Liddell(n)

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: Ventriloquist Jeff Dunham's world tour visits 12 countries on five continents and presents one culture shock after another for his familiar puppets, including Walter, Peanut, Bubba J and Achmed the Dead Terrorist(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: Are You There, God? It's Me, Jesus
programme.desc: Are You There, God? It's Me, Jesus. This exceedingly irreverent (even by South Park standards) episode features a very funny satirization of Judy Blume's classic novel Are You There God? It's Me Margaret. When Eric suffers from rectal bleeding, he believes he has entered puberty (it's actually an infection). Upset about his lack of physical maturity, Stan convinces mad Dr. Mephisto to expedite the onset of puberty. Not surprisingly, things don't go well, but God puts everything straight in the end. "Are You There God? It's Me, Jesus" first aired December 29, 1999, on Comedy Central(n)

programme.desc: In the art of crashing weddings, John Beckwith (Owen Wilson) and Jeremy Grey (Vince Vaughn) are Washington D.C.'s undisputed masters. Guided by their intricate wedding-crashing rules, each week they charm their way into a different wedding -- and romance a different woman to boot. But when they crash the biggest wedding of the year, the ultimate crashers soon find themselves in over their heads as they become hilariously entangled in the eccentricity of the influential political family hosting the event. programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Syndale, Kent: The Fort That Wasn't There.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team have three days to discover whether the Syndale Park Motel in Kent is built on the site of Britain's first Roman fort after the grounds yielded ditches, ramparts, coins and pottery. If so, it could prove the existence of a supply line established when the invading Roman army swept toward London.(n)

programme.title: Natural Born Outlaws

programme.title: Crimes That Shook the World
programme.desc: The story of Belgian Marc Dutroux, who kidnapped, tortured and abused six girls during 1995 and 1996 - four of whom died. The country's initial joy at the rescue of two of the captives turned to horror when information emerged about the police investigation, suggesting that corruption - and not incompetence - led to Dutroux being free to carry on with his crimes for so long. programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: A woman learns to love life when she finds out she won't be around long in this comedy. Georgia Byrd (Queen Latifah) lives in New Orleans, where she works in the cookware department of an upscale gourmet supply shop. While Georgia carries a torch for Sean (LL Cool J), one of her co-workers, she doesn't have the nerve to tell him, and despite her estimable skills in the kitchen, she lives frugally and doesn't put her talent to use. Georgia's good friend Rochelle (Jane Adams) often tells her that life is short and she needs to live a little, but she doesn't pay her much mind until a visit to the doctor reveals that Georgia has a very rare medical condition, and only has three weeks to live. Throwing caution to the wind, Georgia cashes out her life savings and heads to Europe for a last bit of revelry. She checks into a four-star hotel, trades her drab clothes for haute couture, finds herself flirting with a handsome and powerful politician (Giancarlo Esposito), convinces the head of a cooking supplies firm (Timothy Hutton) that she's a high-powered executive from a rival company, and makes friends with a four-star chef (Gérard Depardieu). But when Sean learns the truth about Georgia's condition, he sets out to find her before their chance at romance has passed. Directed by Wayne Wang, Last Holiday is a remake of a 1950 British comedy, which starred Alec Guinness as a salesman with a few weeks to live(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Bernie and Ernie. Jason Heir's documentary Ernie and Bernie, created as part of ESPN Films, tells the story of how basketball player Bernard King became only the third African-American player ever at the University of Tennessee, where he struck up an on-court partnership and an off-court friendship with teammate Ernie Grunfeld(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: I Hate Christian Laettner. A profile of former Duke University basketball stand-out Christian Laettner. Laettner's career at Duke was a lightning rod of attention - along with Coach Mike Krzyzewski, Laettner led the Blue Devils to back-to-back National Championship, while drawing the collective ire of the nation for his cocky and privileged appearance. Director Rory Karpf breaks down the cult of personality that still surrounds Laettner to this day(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: One and Not Done. programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how fresh water acts as a magnet to a variety of creatures on the world's most parched continent. Flocks of flamingos congregate on the inhospitable soda lakes of east Africa, giant crocodiles battle with buffalo on the banks of Zambia's Luangwa river, and cichlid fish use catfish as minders.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: With the drought biting hard, food is in short supply and intrepid monkeys invade the family's safari camp, while lack of water means Saba is struggling to give her guests the experience they expect. Frank and David set off on a dangerous mission to help the biggest bull elephant in northern Kenya.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The family and the camp team celebrate the end of the tourist season, Samburu style. Sabu watches over the elephant mothers as they are about to give birth, while Frank and David try to safeguard the future of Samburu's wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the wildlife eking out an existence in and around the scorching wilderness of the Sahara Desert, where only the toughest survive. It's a constant struggle against dehydration, as zebra battle over dwindling rivers, camels search for water and tiny barn swallows navigate thousands of square miles of barren sand to find a life-saving oasis. The naked mole rat avoids the heat by living a subterranean existence, while the silver ant is able to take on the midday sun - but needs a `spacesuit' to do it.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Honey Badgers - Masters of Mayhem.
programme.desc: Although barely a foot tall, the honey badger has a reputation as one of the most fearless animals in the world, attacking just about anything from venomous snakes to adult lions. This documentary follows a scientist, a beekeeper and a conservationist in South Africa as they set out to discover if the creature is really as fearsome as it is made out to be.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Meerkats: Secrets of an Animal Superstar.
programme.desc: Meerkat pups Squirt and Weeny belong to one of the most famous animal families on the planet and are also part of a 20-year animal behaviour study. David Attenborough narrates the full story of the research, from the early days when it was a challenge to even get close to a meerkat to the latest revelations about these animals and their complex lives.(n)

programme.title: Outback Rangers
programme.desc: The team hunts an infamous crocodile known as Nigel. Following the lives of armed rangers at Kakadu National Park in the Northern Territory, Australia.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Documentary picking up where the Walking with Dinosaurs series left off, imagining life on Earth 16 million years after dinosaurs became extinct. Kenneth Branagh narrates as computer graphics give a new lease of life to the creatures that battled for supremacy throughout this turbulent age. The first episode re-animates the `walking whale' and a fearsome half-tonne flightless bird known as a gastornis.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Computer graphics give a new lease of life to the basilosaurus, a mighty carnivorous whale that occupied an ancient waterway connecting Asia to the Atlantic. Here it is seen desperately foraging for food to sustain its unborn calf, leading to a battle for survival against a rival species. Also featured is the andrewsarchus, a monstrous wolf-like mammal, and the large aquatic pig known as moeritherium.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: The life cycle of the indricothere, a distant relative of the rhino, which grew up to seven metres tall, making it the largest land animal ever to have lived. Narrated by Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Reanimating Australopitheci, one of the first apes to walk upright and considered by anthropologists to be among humankind's earliest forebears. This documentary follows the fortunes of a tribe as its members wander the Ethiopian plains in search of a new home. Along the way they encounter weird and wonderful beasts, the most terrible of which is a sabre-toothed cat with a taste for simian flesh. Narrated by Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Documentary breathing new life into the smilodon, the largest of all sabre-toothed cats, which found itself pitted against new enemies in the form of the giant ground sloth and terrifying birds. The programme tells the story of a male facing a harsh existence as it struggles to survive alone after being excluded from its social group.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Re-creating the freezing wastelands of the Ice Age 30,000 years ago, as worsening winter conditions force a mammoth herd to head south for the relative safety of an Alpine valley. The journey is fraught with danger as frozen bogs line the path and their every move is watched by the predatory eyes of a hungry cave lion, while a group of Neanderthals lies in ambush in preparation for the biggest hunt of the year. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: Documentary following palaeontologists searching for dinosaur fossils. A team of scientists searches for the skull bones of what may be a brand new species of horned dinosaurs.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: A team searches a 100-year-old dig site to find the remains of a 73-million-year-old armoured dinosaur, while a paleontologist couple tries to airlift a 4,000kg skeleton.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: In the Bay of Fundy, scientists search for the earliest dinosaurs, while a team in British Columbia tracks dino-prints up a steep rock face.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Documentary picking up where the Walking with Dinosaurs series left off, imagining life on Earth 16 million years after dinosaurs became extinct. The programme tells the story of a male facing a harsh existence as it struggles to survive alone after being excluded from its social group.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Re-creating the freezing wastelands of the Ice Age 30,000 years ago, as worsening winter conditions force a mammoth herd to head south for the relative safety of an Alpine valley. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts

The first episode re-animates the `walking whale' and a fearsome half-tonne flightless bird known as a gastornis.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts

Also featured is the andrewsarchus, a monstrous wolf-like mammal, and the large aquatic pig known as moeritherium.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A criminal profiler joins the team to help investigate a double murder case that bears resemblances to crimes committed a decade previously by a serial killer known as the Caveman. Jane clashes with the newcomer's scientific approach and disagrees with her theories about potential suspects - so he fabricates a piece of evidence to throw her off course in the hope of outwitting the real culprit. Crime drama, guest starring Linda Park (Raines).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Rigsby travel to Crane Creek, where they examine the murder of a film-maker who has been shot at close range. The local police identify a man who was accused of killing his wife two years previously as the main suspect, but when the agents close in, he takes the employees and customers at City Hall hostage, including Jane, who was settling a parking fine at the time. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team fakes the discovery of a legendary antique car to lure a Wall Street fraudster into breaking the immunity deal that protects him from prosecution. programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: A broken leg leaves Parker behind on the crew's latest job. She spies on the Brew pub's customers for fun and discovers a group of thieves planning a heist.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While transporting the corpse of Lt Gordon Roth to the morgue, a flat tyre brings Ducky and Jimmy to a halt and they are abducted and taken to a remote cabin - where one of their captors wants the post-mortem to take place. Back at the scene, Abby finds a blood sample that does not belong to the victim, who in fact bore little resemblance to the picture of Roth in his old school yearbook. Guest starring Valerie Cruz (The Following).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is stabbed to death after stepping out of her shower, becoming the latest victim of the Dead Rose Slasher. Gibbs is approached by his old friend and barber Frankie Dean, who shares his concern that his son Cameron may be the killer. He explains that a photo-fit released to the media resembles him, and the attacks stopped during a period coinciding with his three-year stint in the navy. Meanwhile, Tony has to take probationary agent Ned Dorneget under his wing.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Van Pelt looks after a man who is willing to testify against a drug dealer, but her career is put in jeopardy when the witness is murdered. Jane learns the identity of the killer after questioning the victim's daughter, so the team rushes her to a safe house and waits for the hired gun to finish the job - only to be shocked by who appears. Crime drama, starring Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The team investigates when a struggling gold prospector is killed, but Lisbon is injured during the opening stages of the case and Hightower takes her place. The detectives speak to the man's family and become suspicious when they discover his girlfriend had bought a one-way ticket to San Francisco a week earlier. Simon Baker, Robin Tunney and Aunjanue Ellis star.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team joins forces with a colonel to stop a terrorist who plans to use a biological attack on the nation's capital. Drama, starring Timothy Hutton and Christian Kane.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Sophie is suspected of stealing a rare painting, and Nate must not only help to clear her name but make sure he and his ex-partner Sterling find the real thief. Drama about hi-tech crooks who use their skills to right corporate wrongs, battle injustice in the corridors of power and steal from wealthy criminals.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Marine sergeant Teddy Lemere is killed by a sniper in Afghanistan just after his sniffer dog helps guide a young child out of a minefield. Back in the US, his widow Ruby tells Gibbs and the team that she had recently received a message from her husband saying he might have upset a few people. Abby retrieves a tiny shard of the sniper's bullet from Ted's helmet and finds that it was made in America.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A doctor dies on board the USS Borealis during a heavy storm and when the ship is brought into Norfolk Naval Yard, Ducky's investigation reveals a telltale mark on the victim's carotid artery, suggesting he was injected with poison. Initial inquiries focus on a petty officer with a history of drug use who may have wanted the doctor to remain silent about his problems. American drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American naval crime drama returns, joined by a new recruit played by Jennifer Esposito. programme.desc: Stan discovers Francine has a memorial garden to ex-lovers and starts to fear their marriage is falling apart - prompting her to ask for a divorce. Meanwhile, Steve becomes addicted to an energy drink.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police in Pierce County, Washington, respond to a call about a belligerent tow-truck operator, while officers in Las Vegas provide backup during a not-so-routine traffic violation.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police in California chase a driver who refused to stop following a hit-and-run, and officers in Amarillo, Texas, try to stop a belligerent drunk causing trouble in a hotel lobby.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Returning from a six-month posting in the Gulf, Navy lieutenant commander Megan Huffner opens her front door to find her husband Noel dead in his chair. Gibbs and the team investigate and find the victim died three or four weeks earlier, and an unusual $100 bill in his wallet proves to be a vital clue. Meanwhile, Tony's father visits for Christmas and looks to rebuild their fractured relationship. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man and his son on a fishing trip hook what appears to be the body of a petty officer, but the dead man turns out to be a journalist who had been investigating the proliferation of drugs in the Navy. Meanwhile, Ziva returns to her car after a workout at the gym to find her father Eli hiding inside. Guest starring Michael Nouri.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Conclusion. After the deaths of two family members of NCIS employees, the team identifies the killer as a Swedish mercenary and the ballistics report reveals the bullets came from an Iranian arms dealer. McGee traces a wire transfer made to the hitman's ex-wife and son to an account under the name Virtue, and Ziva makes a connection after realising what the Hebrew translation is.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a fatal car crash involving marine lance corporal Chad Dunn and student Lyla Cutwright. Duckie notices that the woman's injuries do not match the specifics of the accident and there are no skidmarks found at the scene, leading Gibbs to declare they possibly have a murder and a suicide on their hands. Abby calls in sick for the first time after the case stirs up a traumatic incident from her childhood. Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team capture computer hacker Ajay Khan, who was recently responsible for hacking into NCIS's supposedly ultra-secure multiple-threat alert centre. They believe he could hold the key to tracking down the most-wanted cyber terrorist in the world, who may be plotting an attack using a bomb containing a strain of the Ebola virus. When Khan refuses to co-operate, Ziva and DiNozzo take him to Guantanamo Bay to be placed with people he had previously betrayed. Guest starring Vik Sahay (Chuck).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs, McGee and Torres travel to a remote area of Paraguay controlled by violent rebels, in search of a Navy Seal who disappeared during an unsanctioned trip. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American naval crime drama returns, joined by a new recruit played by Jennifer Esposito. The team investigates a deadly car explosion in DC that seems to be connected to Special Agent Nick Torres's disappearance six months earlier, while on a deep-cover operation in Argentina.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The disappearance of a federal judge's daughter on the same day as her grandmother dies leads the team to the family's guarded home, where security officers insist the girl never left the property. Convinced she was murdered, Jane searches for the body and concludes the victim was placed in her relative's coffin - prompting him to test his theory on the day of the funeral. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and the team investigate a death threat, but find themselves in danger when a building explodes. Meanwhile, Lisbon confronts billionaire Walter Mashburn again when they meet during a case. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is kidnapped, but as Lisbon and the team go back over his previous cases in search of clues to the abductor's identity, they realise he had numerous enemies, any one of whom might be responsible. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane accepts the help of local astrologer Ellis Mars to solve the case of a triple murder involving two police officers. John Billingsley (True Blood) guest stars in an edition of the crime drama directed by leading actor Simon Baker. With Robin Tunney and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI tries to solve the murder of a Santa Claus impersonator, and Jane is questioned by an independent investigator in connection with the death of cop-killer Todd Johnson, who was set on fire while in police custody. Drama, starring Simon Baker, Robin Tunney, Owain Yeoman and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger meets Meredith, the most interesting woman in Langley Falls, and he struggles to create a new, more fabulous persona to keep up with her. When he fails, Francine suggests the dejected alien embark on a journey of self-discovery, which doesn't go exactly as planned. Meanwhile, Stan and the others overdo it during a workout, and end up feeling too sore to move, giving Klaus the chance to throw himself a party.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger talks Francine into taking advantage of Stan's absence by playing the `Widow Game', which involves the two of them posing as widows in order to gain sympathy - and free stuff. However, the fun is spoiled when Francine begins to seriously contemplate how she would survive if Stan really were to die. Meanwhile, Steve and his friends stage wrestling matches in the basement, but things get out of hand when an uninvited participant shows up.(n)

programme.title: District 9
programme.desc: Neill Blomkamp's debut feature is a thoughtful sci-fi thriller about aliens stranded on Earth, which tells a social parable that couldn't be more apposite to its South African setting. Back in the early 80s a spaceship grinds to a halt above Johannesburg. On investigation, the colossal craft is found to house insect-like bipeds, all in a very bad shape. Eventually allowed to land on the planet, the occupants are confined to District 9, a shabby outlying suburb. Now, around 20 years later, the entire population of 'prawns', as the aliens have offensively been labelled, are to be moved to a distant detention camp, with Afrikaner bureaucrat Wikus van de Merwe placed in charge of their relocation. But when a grim accident befalls van de Merwe, he's given a radically different perspective on the affair, as well as little choice but to team up with the extra-terrestrials. Mixing elements of horror and action-thriller into the allegorical whole, the Oscar- and BAFTA-nominated fantasy, produced by Peter Jackson, uses top-notch CGI to both create a believable setting and to move the pace along nicely. In English, with subtitles for the dialogue in Afrikaans, Nyanja, Zulu, Xhosa, Sotho and the aliens' language(n)

programme.title: Mike & Molly

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: In order to prevent a grim future in which mutants and their human sympathizers are systematically hunted and killed by towering, unstoppable robots called Sentinels, Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) travels back in time to change the course of history in this sequel that finds X-Men and X2: X-Men United director Bryan Singer returning to the helm. The film opens in a dark and desolate future that was set in motion in 1973, when brilliant scientist Dr. Bolivar Trask (Peter Dinklage) created a series of giant robots called Sentinels for the sole purpose of wiping out mutants, whom he claimed were a direct threat to the human race. Although initially programmed solely to target mutants, the Sentinels soon began eradicating humans who possessed the DNA to breed mutants, and eventually, any mortal mutant sympathizers. Desperate, Prof. Xavier (Patrick Stewart) and Magneto (Ian McKellen) devise a plan to have Kitty Pryde (Ellen Page) send Wolverine back to the year when Mystique (Jennifer Lawrence) assassinated Trask -- it turns out that Mystique inadvertently accelerated the Sentinel program when she was subsequently captured by Sgt. William Stryker (Josh Helman), who succeeded at harvesting her DNA to make the robots more powerful than ever before. Upon arriving in the past, Wolverine quickly seeks out a much younger Charles Xavier (James McAvoy), as well as Beast (Nicholas Hoult) and Quicksilver (Evan Peters), and together they help break a young Magneto (Michael Fassbender) out of a heavily fortified prison cell hundreds of feet beneath the Pentagon. Meanwhile, with the help of Havok, Ink, Toad, and Spike, Mystique is already moving in for the kill. Although Wolverine, Beast, Charles, and Magneto manage to thwart the assassination, Charles and Magneto once again find themselves at odds after the latter attempts to alter the plan at the last moment, creating a mass panic during a post-Vietnam War peace summit in Paris. And Dr. Trask, still fuming from having had the Sentinel program rejected by Congress, takes his proposal directly to President Nixon (Mark Camacho), laying the groundwork for an even darker future than the one Wolverine was sent back to prevent(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: In order to prevent a grim future in which mutants and their human sympathizers are systematically hunted and killed by towering, unstoppable robots called Sentinels, Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) travels back in time to change the course of history in this sequel that finds X-Men and X2: X-Men United director Bryan Singer returning to the helm. William Stryker (Josh Helman), who succeeded at harvesting her DNA to make the robots more powerful than ever before. And Dr. Trask, still fuming from having had the Sentinel program rejected by Congress, takes his proposal directly to President Nixon (Mark Camacho), laying the groundwork for an even darker future than the one Wolverine was sent back to prevent(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Anarchy
programme.desc: A vengeful father comes to the aid of a mother, her teenage daughter, and a defenseless young couple on the one night of the year that all crime, including murder, is legal in this self-contained sequel from co-producer Jason Blum and original Purge writer/director James DeMonaco. As the countdown to the Purge starts ticking, struggling waitress Eva (Carmen Ejogo) risks her safety by staying late at work to ask her boss for a raise. Later, as she returns home to her elderly father (John Beasley) and daughter Cali (Zoë Soul), bickering couple Shane (Zach Gilford) and Liz (Kiele Sanchez) attempt to make their way out of the city following a frightening run-in with a gang of masked, machete-wielding thugs. While these five people are eager to seek sanctuary from the impending wave of violence about to flood the streets, a lone stranger (Frank Grillo) intent on seeking vengeance for the wrongful death of his son plans to draw blood from the man responsible. Armed to the teeth as he cruises the city in a modified muscle car, he gets sidetracked from his mission when he sees Eva and Cali fighting for their lives against a small army of black-clad soldiers. Against his better judgment, he rescues the pair, only realizing later that Shane and Liz also jumped into his backseat in order to escape a gang that disabled their car and were hunting them through the streets. When the stranger's car is similarly damaged beyond the point of repair, this unlikely group must stick together in order to survive the night. But little do they realize that their nightmare has only just begun(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: The officers are elated to learn Gasforth FC have made it to the next round of the FA Cup in a match they're going to have to police. Grim wastes no time toughening up his men for a possible confrontation with hooligans, much to the distress of Fowler, who believes he's in line for an MBE if he manages to avoid trouble. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, David Haig and Mark Addy.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor tempts fate by agreeing to look after neighbours Patrick and Pippa's house while they're away - a situation made even more volatile by the arrival of his brother Alfred, who proceeds to rub him up the wrong way. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Richard Pearson.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Looking Sideways at Nelly?.
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists the help of Aunty Wainwright to become a master of disguise and deceive his secret enemies, and is delighted when Marina is attracted to his new looks - to the great annoyance of Howard. Meanwhile, a misunderstanding over a neck injury puts the police on Alvin and Entwistle's trail.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Nobody Messes with Tony the Throat.
programme.desc: Hobbo, Alvin and Entwistle set out to save the day when Howard suspects Pearl is seeing someone else and the trio soon draw up a surveillance operation that leads them to a seedy bikers' club. Toby sets out to find Aunty Wainwright when he has ironing problems.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Stella Find True Love with Norris Fairburn?.
programme.desc: After suffering a brush with Stella, Hobbo comes to the conclusion that it is time to find her a man - and, with the help of Clegg and Truly, he decides that eligible village heart-throb Norris Fairburn is the right match. Pearl's new-found passion for motorcycling causes trouble for Howard and Marina.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: The officers are elated to learn Gasforth FC have made it to the next round of the FA Cup in a match they're going to have to police. Grim wastes no time toughening up his men for a possible confrontation with hooligans, much to the distress of Fowler, who believes he's in line for an MBE if he manages to avoid trouble. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, David Haig and Mark Addy.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.sub-title: It Never Rained in Those Days.
programme.desc: Mother's demands make life miserable for the family on her birthday. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett and Barbara Lott.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor tempts fate by agreeing to look after neighbours Patrick and Pippa's house while they're away - a situation made even more volatile by the arrival of his brother Alfred, who proceeds to rub him up the wrong way. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Richard Pearson.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Randolph Make a Good Impression?.
programme.desc: Hobbo's quest to find a man for Stella leads him to put up an advertisement, but the suitor who turns up lacks what it takes to tackle the widow and runs off. However, a chance to hit back emerges when Hobbo finds out who Stella's favourite movie character is.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Father's Day.
programme.desc: Convinced that Nelly is his mother, Hobbo sends Howard to eavesdrop on her and Pearl as he tries to find out more about his father. However, when the women concoct some false information, the police start to take an interest in the men's activities. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, June Whitfield and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom draws on every resource in his efforts to practise self-sufficiency and builds a generator that runs on animal dung. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom is tempted to earn some extra money, but it is not to pay the bills or replenish his dwindling savings. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington. First broadcast in 1975.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2003. As Rodney and Cassandra prepare for the arrival of their own little plonker, the Trotter brothers must raise the money they need to pay back the Inland Revenue or risk losing their cherished flat in Nelson Mandela House - but an old photo soon takes the plot into much darker territory. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong and John Challis star in the last-ever episode.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as a doting mother-of-six who constantly interferes in her children's lives. Agnes tries to solve her son Dermot's relationship problems by giving his girlfriend advice, and Grandad ends up in hospital after Dr Flynn's attempt to read his temperature goes awry.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.sub-title: The Royle Family Special: Joe's Crackers.
programme.desc: It is Christmas Day in the Royle household, and Jim is out of action following an unfortunate incident in the precinct, while Dave and Denise are concerned their gift of a fridge magnet looks poor next to the lavish presents brought by Anthony. Next door neighbours Joe and Cheryl are later invited over for Christmas dinner - but the family does not bank on the recently deceased Mary turning up too. Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston, Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash and Ralf Little star in a festive edition of the comedy from 2010.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: After inheriting £600 the duo head off for a night at the fair. Richie's wallet is stolen, but that proves to be the least of his problems as a fortune teller declares that he is going to die in three nights' time. Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Eddie and Richie agree to mind their landlord's shop - and end up irritating the locals so much they find themselves facing a gang of looters. John Wells guest stars, alongside Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson as the puerile flatmates.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Daisy is stunned to get a job interview with a fashionable magazine, Tim's world is plagued by the living dead and Brian receives an unusual invitation from a former collaborator. Guest starring David Walliams and Paul Kaye.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Daisy receives distressing news from her boyfriend, and takes it so badly that she buys a dog to cheer herself up. Meanwhile, Tim and Mike go paintballing, only to encounter an arch enemy. Comedy, starring Simon Pegg and Jessica Hynes, with Peter Serafinowicz (Look Around You).(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: The National Lottery could be the answer to the couple's financial troubles, but when they form a syndicate with their neighbours and their numbers come up, Bridget is unhappy about the win. Comedy set in the 1980s, starring Jennifer Zamparelli and Bernard O'Shea.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: Bridget has to get one for the first time ever when her husband loses his job, while - with nothing to do - Eamon accidentally joins the IRA. Comedy, starring Jennifer Zamparelli and Bernard O'Shea.(n)

programme.title: Monty Python's Best Bits (Mostly)
programme.desc: The troupe's most popular sketches, with interjections from some of the biggest names in comedy revealing what makes Monty Python so special. Featuring the Parrot Sketch, the Ministry of Silly Walks and praise from Chevy Chase and Steve Coogan. Presented by Hugh Bonneville.(n)

programme.title: Bottom

programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.desc: In the concluding episode, Paul O'Grady charts Bob Monkhouse's reinvention as the elder statesman of British comedy from 1994 to his death in 2003, and sees how at the end of his life Bob was performing some of his most outstanding comedic work.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Dawn French narrates this series finding out more about some of the nation's favourite performers, beginning with Kenneth Williams. In interviews with the most celebrated interrogators such as David Frost, Michael Parkinson, Terry Wogan and Russell Harty, the raconteur talks openly about his frustrations, phobias and darkest moments.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Romance Springs a Leak.
programme.desc: When Hobbo learns that Howard feels he is taken for granted by Pearl and that Toby misses his former wife, he hatches a plan to sort out their love lives - with the help of flowers, a Mario Lanza recording and his own team of miming violinists.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Father's Day.
programme.desc: Convinced that Nelly is his mother, Hobbo sends Howard to eavesdrop on her and Pearl as he tries to find out more about his father. However, when the women concoct some false information, the police start to take an interest in the men's activities. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, June Whitfield and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Meanwhile, Rodney plunges to the depths of despair as his marriage continues to deteriorate. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2003. As Rodney and Cassandra prepare for the arrival of their own little plonker, the Trotter brothers must raise the money they need to pay back the Inland Revenue or risk losing their cherished flat in Nelson Mandela House - but an old photo soon takes the plot into much darker territory. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong and John Challis star in the last-ever episode.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del becomes a showbiz entrepreneur after discovering a sensational Tom Jones-style singer at a local club. Teaming him up with Raquel, he wastes no time in booking the duo at a birthday party for the elderly mother of a local hoodlum - but it soon becomes clear his new signing is not everything he is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nag's Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Return of the sitcom about a British Pakistani family in Sparkhill, Birmingham, whose father sees himself as a pillar of the community - even if nobody else does. Mr Khan is lumbered with looking after his mother-in-law, until a miracle happens - she announces she wants to move into a home. The head of a local care centre arrives, plans are made and Khan is over the moon - until he realises his elderly relative is worth quite a bit of money. Can he stop her leaving after all? Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi star, with a guest appearance from Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: With Shazia and Amjad's wedding fast approaching, the Khans invite the Maliks over for dinner, concerned they have never hit it off with the groom's mother - and also hope Amjad's father can help Mr Khan get onto a business committee. They pull out all the stops to impress, with Mrs Khan cooking up a storm in the kitchen, parlour games being organised, Mr Khan buying a new suit, and the couple even having a new piece of furniture to show off. But then an unexpected phone call jeopardises the event. Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor star, with guest appearances by Ted Robbins and Colin McFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan takes on more shifts at the supermarket, leaving her husband in charge of the house - and in his new role, he introduces strict rules and even sends his younger daughter to London for work experience at a mosque. Never one to miss out on a bargain, he then abuses his wife's staff discount card and starts selling nappies to his neighbours at a healthy profit. But when Alia returns from the capital with his domineering sister-in-law Aunty Noor, it looks like his dodgy scam is in danger of being exposed to Mrs Khan. Nina Wadia guest stars in the sitcom, with Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The students plan a spectacular protest to prevent council officials demolishing their house. First-ever episode of the anarchic comedy. Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan star, with Alexei Sayle and mod band Nine Below Zero.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The hard-up housemates strike oil in the basement, and think they have found the answer to their financial woes. However, super-smooth Mike decides the time is ripe for a coup, and declares himself house-dictator. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Ade Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including pigeon, trout, pancetta, cherries, pears and dark chocolate. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Charles Campion - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood tackle the signature, technical and showstopper challenges from the second half of the series. Mary makes a sugar-free carrot cake and an apricot frangipane tart, while Paul demonstrates the correct way to make Cypriot flaounas, which left the bakers bewildered in the technical challenge from pastry week, and then prepares a game pie with hot-water crust pastry followed by a lime and passion fruit Charlotte russe.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It's the first quarter-final and the heat winners continue to battle for their place in the competition. The Palate Test sees them recreating John Torode's jungle curry with coconut and lime rice, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the dish and write down what they think the ingredients are. They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic William Sitwell - and it had better be good, as for some of them, it will be their last time in the MasterChef kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Pacific Island Feasts with Peter Kuruvita
programme.desc: The presenter follows his passion for seafood and fishing to the northern region of the Philippines, where he samples the delights of crab kinilaw.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nation's love of bread, tracing its development over the course of centuries. In addition to trying their hands at bagel-making, they create their own version of summer pudding, and prepare a soup-and-roll combination.(n)

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay embarks on a culinary journey across India to learn how to authentically prepare the signature dishes of the country. He begins his journey on an express train in the north, where he cooks for the passengers in the cramped pantry car. He then caters for a large wedding, before venturing into the jungle and scaling a 40ft tree in search of a local tribe's favourite delicacy.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge challenges fellow chef Glynn Purnell to create a recipe from scratch to go up against his own new creation, with each having a set of rules to work from, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack tries to persuade them to be open-minded as he asks them to sample wine from a surprising source. Plus, comedy actress Arabella Weir meets a man who puts many chefs to shame when it comes to experimenting with flavour.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Sat Bains joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to chat about the future of food and demonstrate his take on a traditional bread and butter pudding, using cutting-edge culinary equipment to create a modern twist on this classic dish. Drinks expert Kate Goodman picks dessert wines to provide the ideal accompaniment, while food writer Stefan Gates examines the pros and cons of meat that has been grown in a laboratory.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef explores the west coast of Scotland, discovering why the sheltered lochs are the perfect environment for langoustines to thrive and why Highland beef is lean and full of flavour. On his journey he prepares deep-fried langoustines and mussels in a vodka and tonic batter, and a Thai-style Highland beef salad.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef heads to his home county of Yorkshire, where he studies the landscape from above and investigates the unique environmental factors that have contributed to the creation of West Yorkshire's Rhubarb Triangle. He also examines why the region's wild heather honey is so distinctive, and prepares blow-torched mackerel served with rhubarb chutney and a honey and meringue roulade.(n)

Mary makes a sugar-free carrot cake and an apricot frangipane tart, while Paul demonstrates the correct way to make Cypriot flaounas, which left the bakers bewildered in the technical challenge from pastry week, and then prepares a game pie with hot-water crust pastry followed by a lime and passion fruit Charlotte russe.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It's the first quarter-final and the heat winners continue to battle for their place in the competition. The Palate Test sees them recreating John Torode's jungle curry with coconut and lime rice, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the dish and write down what they think the ingredients are. They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic William Sitwell - and it had better be good, as for some of them, it will be their last time in the MasterChef kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Pacific Island Feasts with Peter Kuruvita
programme.desc: The presenter follows his passion for seafood and fishing to the northern region of the Philippines, where he samples the delights of crab kinilaw.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including pigeon, trout, pancetta, cherries, pears and dark chocolate. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Charles Campion - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nation's love of bread, tracing its development over the course of centuries. In addition to trying their hands at bagel-making, they create their own version of summer pudding, and prepare a soup-and-roll combination.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge challenges fellow chef Glynn Purnell to create a recipe from scratch to go up against his own new creation, with each having a set of rules to work from, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack tries to persuade them to be open-minded as he asks them to sample wine from a surprising source. Plus, comedy actress Arabella Weir meets a man who puts many chefs to shame when it comes to experimenting with flavour.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Sat Bains joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to chat about the future of food and demonstrate his take on a traditional bread and butter pudding, using cutting-edge culinary equipment to create a modern twist on this classic dish. Drinks expert Kate Goodman picks dessert wines to provide the ideal accompaniment, while food writer Stefan Gates examines the pros and cons of meat that has been grown in a laboratory.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The three remaining hopefuls join forces to practise a fine-dining menu before the penultimate task of the contest - to prepare one course each of a three-course menu, designed by Italian chef Massimo Bottura and judged by five of his contemporaries - Marcus Wareing, Daniel Clifford, Andrew Fairlie, Anthony Demetre and Francesco Mazzei. This is the amateurs' chance to show the best of the best that they have what it takes to one day join their ranks. But will nerves get the better of them?.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After seven weeks of challenges, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax. The three would-be chefs pull out all the stops as they produce their final three courses, the likes of which they have never cooked before. Then it's over to judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace to decide which of the trio deserves to succeed last year's victor Ping Coombes and be crowned MasterChef Champion 2015.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food starts to smell the salty Mediterranean sea on the warm breeze and serves freshly grilled sardines with salad and cold rose wine for the boat crew as they reach Narbonne. Meanwhile, Louis, the chef onboard Anjodi, rustles up seafood with squid ink pasta.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: The chef rustles up more delicious seafood delights inspired by his travels. As spring arrives in Cornwall, Rick cooks seafood paella, spicy Thai fish curry, and scallops.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: The chef rustles up more delicious seafood delights inspired by his travels.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: A fisherwoman in Padstow harbour cooks squid with red wine for the chef. Rick also visits Brittany in France to sample its local fish restaurants and cafes, before discovering how to make the perfect bouillabaisse in Marseilles.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: The chef goes hunting for spider crabs to whip up a dish of crabmeat with wine and garlic, before revealing a few tricks of the trade to the chefs at Blenheim Palace as they prepare a seafood banquet.(n)

programme.title: Donnie Brasco
programme.desc: Johnny Depp is Donnie Brasco, a Mafia mobster who's thick as thieves with Lefty Ruggerio (Al Pacino), a leading man in the Organisation. But Donnie is also Joe Pistone, an Fbi agent sent to infiltrate who instead becomes seduced by the camaraderie on offer. Mike Newell's film, based on a true story (Pistone is still part of the witness protection programme), is more concerned about friendship, loyalty and the agony of duplicity than the reality of mob violence(n)

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars in director Tony Scott's revenge thriller. Alcoholic former CIA agent John Creasy tries to escape his troubled past by moving to Mexico City, where he takes a job as bodyguard to a rich businessman's 10-year-old daughter Lupita. Gradually, Creasy's new employment begins to mend his damaged persona as he bonds with the girl. But the Mexican capital's reputation for kidnapping proves accurate as she is snatched and a ransom is demanded. So Creasy sets out to track down and inflict maximum, grisly pain on everyone involved in Lupita's abduction(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A sleep-deprived detective plays an intense cat-and-mouse game with a sly murderer in a remote Alaska town. A remake of the 1997 Norwegian film of the same name(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Frank Abagnale, Jr worked as a doctor, a lawyer and as a co-pilot for a major airline - all before his 18th birthday. A master of deception, he was also a brilliant forger whose skill gave him his first real claim to fame. At the age of 17, Frank became the most successful bank robber in the history of the United States. FBI Agent Carl Hanratty had made it his prime mission to capture Frank and bring him to justice, but Frank is always one step ahead of him, baiting him to continue the chase(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Wonderfully rewarding urban fairy tale about a 12-year-old prodigy (the marvelous Freddie Highmore) who heads to New York City to find and reunite with the musician parents who abandoned him as a baby. Keri Russell and Jonathan Rhys Meyers costar as the young lovebirds who made sweet music (and a child) before their romance was dramatically and untimely cut short. Directed by Kirsten Sheridan. Robin Williams is a gas as a modern-day Fagin trying to "help" the lad in his quest(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Birth of a Nation'
programme.desc: A look at "The Birth of a Nation," a 2016 dramatic retelling of American-born Nat Turner's bloody rebellion to free slaves in Virginia in 1831. The film stars Nate Parker, Aja Naomi King and Armie Hammer, and is written and directed by Parker(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: An atmospheric phenomenon enables a New York police officer to communicate with his beloved dead father, a fire fighter and amateur radio enthusiast, across thirty years of time. He manages to warn his father of his own death, but by changing events in history they unwittingly cause a tragedy, and now need to try to alter history again(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: A renowned Harvard psychiatrist (with a concealed fear of heights) takes over as director of the PsychoNeurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous after the last administrator dies under suspicious circumstances(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: In Shawn Levy's romantic comedy, Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy play Tom Leezak and Sarah McNerney, a chalk-and-cheese couple who fall in love and marry. Now, all they need for the union to work is to survive both families disapproval of the match, deal with the well-meaning friends who meddle too much and, on their honeymoon, suffer a selection of Europe's worst accommodation. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson, a former mercenary, is tricked into volunteering as the subject of a bizarre experiment that gives him superhuman abilities. He becomes an antihero with a warped sense of humour and goes on a mission to hunt down the people who are responsible for his twisted condition(n)
